sentences.sContent: I’m not usually attracted to blondes.
sentences.sCn: 我一般不喜欢金发女子。

sentences.sContent: ...One should enter it vaguely, and allow what is there freely to attract and influence the eye to walk the rounds of the bookshops...
...it would attract funding and change the way we do health care...
...Infants cry to attract attention for survival...
...along with their ability to attract the best talent...
...so the government needs to ensure that institutions have all the support they need to attract international students who make a tremendous academic...
...The globalization of education means more universities will be seeking heads with international experience of some kind of promote international programs and attract a global student body...
...and business magazines have all seen increases in advertising because they attract the high-end market...
...radio will increasingly attract target audiences who live many miles apart...

phrases.pCn: 吸引外商投资；对外招商

remMethod.val: at(表加强) ＋ tract(拉) → 拉过来 → 吸引

words.tran: 吸引人的；有魅力的；引人注目的
迷人地；有吸引力地；动人地
吸引，吸引力；引力；吸引人的事物
[自] 吸引子；引起注意的人

trans.tranOther: to make someone interested in something, or make them want to take part in something
